column4: Can I raise this qstn again, pls? I'm planning to resize a couple of partitions because I've run out of space on /usr and want to give it more space. Since that's dangerous, I wanted to sanity-check my plan before running around with scissors <g>

The plan: Backup /home. Take 15GB from /home (/dev/hda14 in my current scheme). Move /tmp, /var, and /usr/local (hda 11, hda12, and hda13) into the free space after current hda14. Move the free space that's left (there will be about 10GB left) so that it's adjacent to /usr (hda10 in current scheme). Add the space to /usr. Edit /etc/fstab to reflect changes. Mount /home and /usr manually to make sure they're OK.
sounds reasonable... how are you planning on copy the data?
are you sure? my /tmp is tmpfs... i.e. not a real partition at all
just see what 'mount' outputs... chances are you are already using it (which means you have wasted space :)
ah, looks like you really are using a partition for /tmp, which isn't really necessary (actually it isn't to recommend)
please get a second opinion before you go ahead, I don't want to become known as "destroyer of Ubuntu systems"
if you can wait until tomorrow you can always send me an email so I can get all the details right
- I can certainly wait; no urgency (or at least, I don't think I've got any urgency)
how the hell do I send a private message? I don't want to advertise my email address to the world
write down your plan as well so I can read through it with no pressure :)
